Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Collagenase Clostridium Histolyticum Injection for Adhesive Capsulitis

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, 60 patients with adhesive capsulitis were recruited

Participants.evidence: 60 patients with adhesive capsulitis were recruited based on restricted active ROM of at least 60° in the affected shoulder

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive a single injection of 0.5 mL placebo or 0.145, 0.29, or 0.58 mg CCH

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy of collagenase clostridium histolyticum (CCH) injections compared to physical therapy

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was active forward flexion improvement at 30 days

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors

Number_Randomised.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, 60 patients with adhesive capsulitis were recruited

Result_Outcome.evidence: CCH at 0.58 mg/1 mL and 0.58 mg/2 mL showed greater improvement in active forward flexion compared to exercise alone (mean difference: 26° and 31°, p = 0.03 and p = 0.01, respectively)
